heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 16.6mm per hour was the peak rain rate recorded today ranking 2nd in our overall records.  The storm lasted 3.2 hours and 5.69mm of rain fell.  The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm we experienced was on 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: A significant rainy period is on-going and is ranked 4th for length since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 10 consecutive days beginning 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (196°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.0°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 9%) and rainfall (down 1.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 1.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 2.0°C), inside temperature (up 1.8°C), outside temperature (up 1.5°C), and cloud levels (up 780 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 718.6m higher than yesterday, 288.5m higher than the past week, 779.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 565m to a maximum of 1838m, averaging 1829.1m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1540.6m and 2610m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, pleasant humidity levels and little or no wind. Moderate rainfall, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and strong and powerful sunlight. Weather could become unsettled.
